Description: Handle zone sherd of Attic black-figured pottery little master cup; interior black; exterior: black figure decoration consisting of horse galloping to right (trace of chest and forelegs remain); below, trace of black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 90 no. 304 pl. 67)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 423, no. B666, pl. XXVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1337) (phase 3)
